uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.forms

Interface CreateCustomizer<BDO extends DataObject>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CreateTemplate<BDO>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppUserFactory.SignupFormCreator, ClassificationFactory.ClassificationCreator, CreateComposite, CreateTransition, Creator, DynamicFormTransitionProvider.Creator, PartManager.PartCreator, RegistrationDateComposite, SignupDateComposite, TextFileOverlay.TextFileCreator

    public interface CreateCustomizer<BDO extends DataObject>
    Objects that customize a creation form. These can be a CreateTemplate or a Composite attached to the factory.
    Author:
    spb
     

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void customiseCreationForm(Form f)
      Perform target specific customisation of a creation Form.

    • Method Detail

      • customiseCreationForm

        void customiseCreationForm(Form f)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Perform target specific customisation of a creation Form. For example adding a special validator. Note that this is called in addition to the basic customiseForm call
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        f - Form to be modified

      • preCommit

        void preCommit(BDO dat,
             Form f)
               throws DataException
        Populate target from creation form. This can be sub-classes to add additional information such as the requesting Person or other information derived other than from the form parameters. Normally the form contents have already been set in the Object but the form is passed to this method in case any form parameters are used to control the way the object is created.
        Throws:
        DataException
        Parameters:
        dat - Object being created
        f - Form providing parameters

              Form f)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Take any action after object commit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        dat -
        f -
